revised_title: Thermodynamic Theory of Steam-Engines with Dry Saturated Steam
tldr: The author investigates the thermodynamic theory of steam engines using dry saturated steam and its application to practice. He presents exact and approximate formulas for the work of steam, considering the expansion with heat and efficiency in producing motive power. The study confirms the theoretical conclusion that a portion of steam must be liquefied during expansion, and the steam-jacket invented by Watt prevents this liquefaction.
